intro: Machaerium verrucosum, commonly known as the rough machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Machaerium verrucosum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savannas and grasslands. Its growth habit makes it an important component of the ecological systems in its native habitats.
